1603.bart_summary: Alaska Department of Fish and Game Biologist Tom Seaton led 100 wood bison to freedom on a snowmobile. The land mammals were freed from a temporary pen, where they had been kept for just over a week during the transition. Wood bison are North America’s largest land mammal, but the native Alaskan species disappeared from the state more than 100 years ago.
